positive_examples: This is an example of choice axiom.
The choice axiom demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed choice axiom in this context.
A typical case of choice axiom would involve these features.
The concept of choice axiom applies here.
The mathematical axiom stating that for any collection of non-empty sets, it is possible to choose one element from each set.
negative_examples: This is an example of superposition principle, not choice axiom.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SuperpositionPrinciple, or other types of Axiom

definition: The set-theoretic axiom asserting that a choice function exists for any collection of sets.
